Class Palette

 Palette information for an image. More...


Defines

#define k_PalCreateRGB(r, g,b)   ((UINT32)(((UINT8)(b) | ((UINT16)(g)<<8)) | (((UINT32)(UINT8)(r))<<16)))
 Create a UINT32 RGB-component from the three components r, g and b.

#define k_PalGetRVal(rgb)   ((UINT8) ((rgb) >> 16))
 Extract the R-value from a UINT32 RGB-component.

#define k_PalGetGVal(rgb)   ((UINT8) (((UINT16) (rgb)) >> 8))
 Extract the G-value from a UINT32 RGB-component.

#define k_PalGetBVal(rgb)   ((UINT8) (rgb))
 Extract the B-value from a UINT32 RGB-component.


Functions

void k_InitPalette (TPalette *pPal)
 Sets all the pointers in pPal to NULL and PalEntries to 0.

void k_EmptyPalette (TPalette *pPal)
 Deletes all allocated memory for the palette, PalEntries is set to 0 and the pPalette pointer to NULL.

 Allocates memory for palette and initialises to gray tones.

 Returns the palette value at "Index" in "pPalValue".

UINT32 k_GetPalColor (int Index, const TPalette *pPal)
 Returns the palette value at "Index".

bool k_SetPalValue (int Index, UINT32 PalValue, TPalette *pPal)
 Sets the palette value to "PalValue" at "Index".

bool k_CopyPalette (TPalette *pDest, const TPalette *pSource)
 Previous data in "pDest" are destroyed unless the function returns false, in that case pDest is unchanged.

bool k_IsPaletteGrayTone (const TPalette *pPal)
 Returns true if the palette is a gray tone palette.

 Prints RGB value to stdout.

void k_PrintPaletteInfo (const TPalette *pPal, unsigned int EntriesPrLine)
 Prinst all palette information to stdout.

Detailed Description

Palette manipulation functions, last updated 10/9/2001.

Including macros to create palette entries and to extract R,G or B components in an entry.

These functions are part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

Version:
1.21
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen edr@mip.sdu.dk

Define Documentation

#define k_PalCreateRGB (  r,
g,
b    )     ((UINT32)(((UINT8)(b) | ((UINT16)(g)<<8)) | (((UINT32)(UINT8)(r))<<16)))
 

Create a UINT32 RGB-component from the three components r, g and b.

The r, g and b components must be UINT8 types, i.e. 8 bits.

bool k_CopyPalette (  TPalette *    pDest,
const TPalette *    pSource
) 
 

Previous data in "pDest" are destroyed unless the function returns false, in that case pDest is unchanged.

Returns :
False, if source and destination palette is the same.

bool k_CreatePal (  unsigned short    Bits,
TPalette *    pPal
) 
 

Allocates memory for palette and initialises to gray tones.

If 24 b/p no palette is created and palette entries is set to 0 (pPal->PalEntries).

Returns :
False if Bits is not 1,4,8 or 24.

UINT32 k_GetPalColor (  int    Index,
const TPalette *    pPal
) 
 

Returns the palette value at "Index".

This function is the same as k_GetPalValue but the result is returned directly from the function instead of in a parameter. Produces an error message if Index is out of range.

Returns :
UINT32 palette value at given index

void k_InitPalette (  TPalette *    pPal )

bool k_IsPaletteGrayTone (  const TPalette *    pPal ) 
 

Returns true if the palette is a gray tone palette.

In a gray tone palette each index value must have the same value in the R,G and B components. For an image with 8 b/p at index M in the palette, the color channels must have R=M, G=M, and B=M. For an image with 1 b/p, index 0 must have R=0, G=0, and B=0 and index 1 must have R=255, G=255, and B=255.

Returns :
True, if palette is a gray tone palette. If palette contains a number of entries different from 2 or 256, false is returned.
